tasks.task: Replace a disintegrated wheel bearing on a tractor.
subtasks: Inspect the wheel to identify the location of the bearing.
Clean the axle shaft and bearing holes on both sides.
Remove the old wheel bearing using a steel bar and hammer.
Prepare the new wheel bearing by greasing the hub and race.
Install the new bearing into the hole, ensuring it's properly positioned.
Insert the grease seal and apply ample grease.
Reassemble the wheel components (washer, castellated nut, cotter key).
Check the wheel bearing's play and adjust accordingly to ensure proper fit.
